reviews.title: Beautiful grounds and nice, clean room
reviews.text: The Inn really is an inn, with narrow hallways and frilly decorations. There are newer cabin-style buildings which seemed to attract families. The room I had was on the ground floor and as someone else mentioned, you can hear every footstep above you, as well as showers in the room next to you. The payoff for ground floor is that it stays cooler and needs less of the AC, which was quiet, but smelled a little "humid.". The highlight was the grounds -- huge lawn broken up by rockeries and a generous amount of adirondack chairs grouped in the various parts of the garden. They have lovely beach access with chairs on the beach. Both nights I was there, after a great steak at Don's Restaurant, I relaxed in a chair on the lawn and watched the other guests and the sunset.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights July 8 2012. Room was very clean and grounds are well looked after. The private beach in front of the hotel is a plus. Lots of beach chairs. Lake was lovely and warm - you can walk out a long way in really shallow water.
reviews.title: Great relaxing time
Always a great place
reviews.text: For a nice meal try the Family Diner - nothing fancy but a really good Turkey Club sandwich served exactly the way it was ordered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Splendid lodging

reviews.text: Always a great place to stay at a reasonable price. Very clean, great staff and comfortable beds. I would have rated a five star, but the overnight stay was somewhat noisy from the street and the morning shower head did not function correctly. But, we will stay again in the future.
reviews.title: Nice place to relax, BUT...
